R22.nl_constraint: City2 is out of fuel, planes can't refuel there

<documents>
<pddl_domain>
;; Enrico Scala (enricos83@gmail.com) and Miquel Ramirez (miquel.ramirez@gmail.com)
(define (domain zenotravel)
        ;(:requirements :typing :fluents)
        (:types
                locatable city - object
                aircraft person - locatable
        )
        (:predicates
                (located ?x - locatable ?c - city)
                (in ?p - person ?a - aircraft)
        )
        (:functions
                (fuel ?a - aircraft)
                (distance ?c1 - city ?c2 - city)
                (slow_burn ?a - aircraft)
                (fast_burn ?a - aircraft)
                (capacity ?a - aircraft)
                (total_fuel_used)
                (onboard ?a - aircraft)
                (zoom_limit ?a - aircraft)

                (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)
        )

        (:action board
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?p ?c)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (located ?p ?c))
                        (in ?p ?a)
                        (increase (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_board ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action debark
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (in ?p ?a)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (in ?p ?a))
                        (located ?p ?c)
                        (decrease (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_debark ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action flyslow
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow_burn ?a))))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total_fuel_used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow_burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow_burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyslow ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action flyfast
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast_burn ?a)))
                        (<= (onboard ?a) (zoom_limit ?a)))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total_fuel_used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast_burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast_burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyfast ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action refuel
                :parameters (?a - aircraft)
                :precondition (and (> (capacity ?a) (fuel ?a))

                )
                :effect (and (assign (fuel ?a) (capacity ?a))
                        (increase (n_refuel ?a) 1))
        )

)
</pddl_domain>
<pddl_problem>
(define (problem ZTRAVEL-3-10)
(:domain zenotravel)
    (:requirements :fluents :typing)
(:objects
	plane1 - aircraft
	plane2 - aircraft
	plane3 - aircraft
	person1 - person
	person2 - person
	person3 - person
	person4 - person
	person5 - person

	person7 - person

	person10 - person
	city0 - city
	city1 - city
	city2 - city
	city3 - city
	city4 - city
	city5 - city
	)
(:init

	(= (capacity plane1) 2326)
	(= (fuel plane1) 205)

	(located person7 city0)

	(= (distance city0 city0) 0)

	(= (distance city1 city1) 0)

	(= (distance city1 city3) 756)

	(= (distance city1 city5) 980)
	(= (distance city2 city0) 565)
	(= (distance city2 city1) 561)
	(= (distance city2 city2) 0)
	(= (distance city2 city3) 657)
	(= (distance city2 city4) 702)
	(= (distance city2 city5) 639)
	(= (distance city3 city0) 886)
	(= (distance city3 city1) 756)
	(= (distance city3 city2) 657)
	(= (distance city3 city3) 0)
	(= (distance city3 city4) 546)
	(= (distance city3 city5) 510)
	(= (distance city4 city0) 596)
	(= (distance city4 city1) 760)
	(= (distance city4 city2) 702)
	(= (distance city4 city3) 546)
	(= (distance city4 city4) 0)
	(= (distance city4 city5) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city0) 766)
	(= (distance city5 city1) 980)
	(= (distance city5 city2) 639)
	(= (distance city5 city3) 510)
	(= (distance city5 city4) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city5) 0)
	(= (total_fuel_used) 0)
)
(:goal (and
	(located plane1 city4)
	(located person1 city4)
	(located person2 city5)
	(located person3 city4)
	(located person4 city0)
	(located person5 city2)
	(located person6 city3)
	(located person8 city0)
	(located person9 city3)
	(located person10 city4)
	))

(:metric minimize (total_fuel_used))


)

<information>
The user will give as input a natural language constraint that must be translated into PDDL3.0. The translation will be used by a PDDL planner.
</information>

<instructions> 
- Translate the input constraint into correct PDDL3.0.
- The resulting PDDL3.0 constraint must capture the same meaning as the initial input constraint.
- Remember that PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based. They can only refer to existing precates and fluents, thus, not to actions.
- Be sure to include temporal logic like operators in your translation.
- Format your answer such as there is no preambule and such that the PDDL translation is between the tags <pddl> and </pddl>.
</instructions>

<user_input>
City2 is out of fuel, planes can't refuel there
</user_input>

The user wants me to translate the constraint "City2 is out of fuel, planes can't refuel there" into PDDL3.0.

Let me analyze what this means:
- This constraint states that planes cannot refuel when they are at city2
- In PDDL3.0, constraints are state-based and use temporal logic operators
- Looking at the domain, there is a refuel action that takes an aircraft as parameter
- The refuel action has preconditions that check if the aircraft's fuel is less than its capacity
- To express that planes can't refuel at city2, I need to add a constraint that prevents the refuel action when the aircraft is located at city2

In PDDL3.0, constraints are typically expressed using the `:constraints` section with temporal logic operators like `always`, `sometime`, `at-most-once`, etc.

Since this is a constraint that should always hold (planes can never refuel at city2), I should use the `always` operator.

The constraint should be:
- Always, if an aircraft is located at city2, then it cannot refuel
- Or more precisely: always, for any aircraft, if it's located at city2, then the refuel action cannot be executed

However, PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based, not action-based. So I need to think about this differently.

Actually, looking more carefully at the domain, the refuel action doesn't have any location-based preconditions explicitly. It just checks if the fuel is less than capacity. 

But the constraint "planes can't refuel at city2" means that whenever a plane is at city2, it should not be able to refuel. 

In PDDL3.0, I can express this as:
```
(always (forall (?a - aircraft) 
    (imply (located ?a city2) 
        (= (fuel ?a) (capacity ?a)))))
```

This would mean that whenever an aircraft is at city2, its fuel must always equal its capacity (i.e., it's always full), which would prevent refueling since the refuel action requires fuel < capacity.
 
I'm exploring alternative approaches to represent the constraint more precisely. The goal is to ensure that when an aircraft is at city2, refueling becomes impossible. I'll examine different ways to capture this state-based restriction in PDDL3.0, focusing on the relationship between location and fuel capacity.

My current strategy involves carefully crafting a constraint that prevents refueling at city2 without overly restricting the problem's solvability. I'm considering the nuanced interactions between aircraft location, fuel levels, and refueling preconditions.

The challenge is to create a constraint that effectively communicates the "out of fuel" status of city2 without making the entire scenario infeasible.

By specifying that aircraft at city2 must always have fuel at maximum capacity, I'm directly implementing the constraint that refueling becomes impossible in this location. This approach ensures the fuel constraint is clear and unambiguous while maintaining the logical integrity of the problem's design.
